item.title: Hackers exploited Sitecore zero-day flaw to deploy backdoors
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors have been exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in legacy Sitecore deployments to deploy WeepSteel reconnaissance malware. [...]

item.title: Texas sues PowerSchool over breach exposing 62M students, 880k Texans
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has filed a lawsuit against education software company PowerSchool, which suffered a massive data breach in December that exposed the personal information of 62 million students, including over 880,000 Texans. [...]

item.title: Chess.com discloses recent data breach via file transfer app
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Chess.com has disclosed a data breach after threat actors gained unauthorized access to a third-party file transfer application used by the platform. [...]

item.title: New TP-Link zero-day surfaces as CISA warns other flaws are exploited
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: TP-Link has confirmed the existence of an unpatched zero-day vulnerability impacting multiple router models, as CISA warns that other router flaws have been exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: France slaps Google with €325M fine for violating cookie regulations
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The French data protection authority has fined Google €325 million ($378 million) for violating cookie regulations and displaying ads between Gmail users' emails without their consent. [...]

item.title: 6 browser-based attacks all security teams should be ready for in 2025
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Push Security
item.description: The browser is now the frontline for cyberattacks. From phishing kits and ClickFix lures to malicious OAuth apps and extensions, attackers are targeting the very place your employees access business-critical apps. Push Security explains how to defend where breaches begin. [...]

item.title: Tire giant Bridgestone confirms cyberattack impacts manufacturing
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Car tire giant Bridgestone confirms it is investigating a cyberattack that impacts the operation of some manufacturing facilities in North America. [...]

item.title: Microsoft says recent Windows updates cause app install issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says the August 2025 security updates are triggering unexpected User Account Control (UAC) prompts and app installation issues for non-admin users across all supported Windows versions. [...]

item.title: Threat actors abuse X’s Grok AI to spread malicious links
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors are using Grok, X's built-in AI assistant, to bypass link posting restrictions that the platform introduced to reduce malicious advertising. [...]

item.title: US offers $10 million bounty for info on Russian FSB hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Department of State is offering a reward of up to $10 million for information on three Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) officers involved in cyberattacks targeting U.S. critical infrastructure organizations on behalf of the Russian government. [...]

item.title: Hackers use new HexStrike-AI tool to rapidly exploit n-day flaws
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are increasingly using a new AI-powered offensive security framework called HexStrike-AI in real attacks to exploit newly disclosed n-day flaws. [...]

item.title: US sues robot toy maker for exposing children's data to Chinese devs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice has sued toy maker Apitor Technology for allegedly allowing a Chinese third party to collect children's geolocation data without their knowledge and parental consent. [...]
